Soft background colors

Use .bg-soft-{color} class to set an element soft background color.

.bg-soft-primary
.bg-soft-success
.bg-soft-info
.bg-soft-warning
.bg-soft-danger
.bg-soft-dark
<div class="bg-soft-primary text-primary"></div>
<div class="bg-soft-success text-success"></div>
<div class="bg-soft-info text-info"></div>
<div class="bg-soft-warning text-warning"></div>
<div class="bg-soft-danger text-danger"></div>
<div class="bg-soft-dark text-dark"></div>

Border color variants

Use .border-gray-{100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900} to set an element border color.

.border-gray-100
.border-gray-200
.border-gray-300
.border-gray-400
.border-gray-500
.border-gray-600
.border-gray-700
.border-gray-800
.border-gray-900
<div class="border border-gray-100"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-200"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-300"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-400"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-500"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-600"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-700"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-800"></div>
<div class="border border-gray-900"></div>
